original_definition: 'fan power input' means the electric power input of a comfort fan in Watt operating at the declared maximum fan flow rate, measured with the oscillating mechanism active (if/when applicable).
generated_definition: 'fan power input' means the ratio of maximum fan flow rate (m3/min) and fan power input (w) for comfort fans.

Article 1: 1.   This Regulation establishes eco-design requirements for the placing on the market of electric mains-operatedair conditioners with arated capacityof ≤ 12 kW for cooling, or heating if the product has no cooling function, andcomfort fans with an electricfan power input ≤ 125W.

1.   This Regulation establishes eco-design requirements for the placing on the market of electric mains-operated air conditioners with a rated capacity of ≤ 12 kW for cooling, or heating if the product has no cooling function, and comfort fans with an electric fan power input ≤ 125W.
Article 2: ‘fan power input’ (PF) means the electric power input of a comfort fan in Watt operating at the declared maximum fan flow rate, measured with the oscillating mechanism active (if/when applicable).
‘fan power input’ (PF) means the electric power input of acomfort fan in Watt operating at the declared maximum fan flow rate, measured with the oscillating mechanism active (if/when applicable).
Article 8: ‘service value’ (SV) [(m3/min)/W] means for comfort fans the ratio of the maximum fan flow rate [m3/min] and the fan power input [W];
‘service value’ (SV) [(m3/min)/W] means forcomfort fans the ratio of the maximum fan flow rate [m3/min] and thefan power input [W];
